reviews.author: Matt
reviews.text:
Update: 11/27/2025
Making yet another update to my review on my continued great experiences as a tenant at the stonewood apartments homes here in Temecula.
I'm probably repeating myself at this point but I really can't get over on how much of a change that has been at these apartments since I moved in about 8 to 9 years ago. It was pretty rough in the beginning but this new team is just amazing. All the ladies on the office team are there to greet you with a warm smile and an open ear. They actually listen, how many folks can say in 2025 your apartment complex is looking out for you?
And that office team is backed by an equally as awesome and amazing maintenance team Wayne, Ernesto & every single one of the gentlemen that work on the maintenance team are great and awesome in their own right. I have been lucky enough to have every single one of the gentlemen working my apartment at one time or another for general routine maintenance.
As much as you all say thank you to us I wanted to say thank you to all of you for making my continued experience here awesome I look forward to MANY more happy years here with y'all.
Thank you to the entire stonewood apartment homes team and staff for your continued kinship and warm rapport  with my family and I.

________________________________________
August 9th 2023:
Well just want to make a quick update to my review. I'm going on now almost 7 years and I'm still loving the Stonewood apartments. Though the staff changes the folks who do come are always fabulous and the current team is even better than that. Big shout out to all the ladies in the leasing office.
Also want to make a quick shout out to the new maintenance staff member his name is Josh, this gentleman did an outstanding job in my apartment and I wanted to give him a public shout out for that. Anyone planning on moving to the stone woods I've been here now 7 years and counting and I don't have any complaints or plans on moving.

Thanks again to ALL the staff, y'all are all awesome.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

reviews.author: Janellie
reviews.text:
Living at The Hunter has been one of those rare experiences where every detail, from the moment you walk into the building to the way the light hits your apartment in the late afternoon, feels intentionally designed to elevate daily life. Even in early December, with the crisp Colorado air outside, our 7th-floor apartment radiates warmth, calm, and effortless elegance.

The extra-tall ceilings immediately transform the space. Light stretches upward and bounces off the quartz countertops, stainless steel appliances, the beautiful kitchen backsplash, and the wood-look flooring. Every corner feels open, airy, and thoughtfully designed. The stackable in-unit washer and dryer, garages, and additional storage options make everyday life smooth, convenient, and unexpectedly luxurious.

The layout options are vast, accommodating a variety of lifestyles, and the balcony is genuinely a private retreat. City views in one direction, mountains in the other — morning coffee, evening sunsets, or just pausing for a quiet moment feel elevated every single time. The apartment feels luxurious without being ostentatious, yet somehow still manages to feel like home.

The amenities go far beyond what one expects from an apartment community. Fitness and movement studios with embroidered towels that somehow make you feel fancy, coworking and conference/Zoom rooms that feel modern and professional, a heated pool and hot tub that are essentially resort-level, and yes, a golf simulator — every detail has been thoughtfully executed. Pet-friendliness is extreme, smart building technology is seamless, and the little touches really set The Hunter apart: custom-named Hunter mugs at the coffee station, embroidered towels in the fitness areas, welcome-home bags, branded pens, and the intercom system that lets guests in without a hitch — all adding layers of polish and thoughtfulness that make everyday living feel elevated.

The staff at The Hunter make the experience even better. Stephanie guided us flawlessly through our lease and moving process, and while Kyla wasn’t our direct agent, her helpfulness is felt throughout the building. Vanessa, the property director, manages the community with professionalism and warmth, and Chris in maintenance is consistently prompt, friendly, and effective. Together, they make the building feel genuinely cared for, not just managed.

The location is ideal: central to downtown Colorado Springs, restaurants, shops, and entertainment, yet tucked back enough to be peaceful and private. You get all the energy of downtown without the hustle and chaos. I had a hard time finding anything wrong — every detail has been thoughtfully executed, every convenience accounted for.

The Hunter even makes the little things feel like a treat. The payment portal is seamless and stress-free, the user-friendly apps make scheduling, rent, and community access effortless, and the intercom adds a level of convenience that makes welcoming guests feel effortless. Honestly, this is the kind of apartment that makes your friends jealous the moment they step in: from the light-filled interiors to the balcony views, the luxe finishes, the thoughtfully curated amenities, and the smart tech everywhere, it’s a living experience that elevates daily life without trying too hard.

If you want to live somewhere that makes you feel like you leveled up in life just by walking through the door… The Hunter is it.
reviews.response_text: We greatly appreciate your detailed and positive feedback on your experience at The Hunter. Thank you for highlighting the thoughtful design, amenities, and exceptional staff.  We strive to provide a warm and welcoming community for all to truly enjoy the elevated living experience, and are glad you're feeling this high level of service since day 1!

reviews.author: Jason Rose
reviews.text: This is an amazing Property with an even more amazing community manager Vanessa Hill. If you’re looking for downtown living with a great property management company, this is the place to go!!!
reviews.response_text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, Jason. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us.

Cheers,
The Hunter

reviews.author: Alizza Lucero

Leasing professional Kyla was great she was very informative about the Hunter property!
Loved her
reviews.response_text: We are happy to hear Kyla provided such informative service about The Hunter property. We truly appreciate your kind words!

reviews.author: Erika Lopez
reviews.text: The managers are so cool actually. The events they put on are so fun!
reviews.response_text: We are excited to hear you enjoy our managers and events! Your support means everything to us.

reviews.author: Alaina Schmidt
reviews.text:
- current resident of 4.5 months
- improper timeline expectations for amenities (couldn’t access mailbox for first two months, grills still not hooked up, still no EV station, no children’s play area)
- extreme construction project due to a builder’s oversight (rushed to slap it together without foresight on drainage codes, no access to garages for over a month due to this). On the fourth month of living here they decided to entirely rip up and repave the areas in front of the garages
- loud machinery, quaking apartment, litter and butts strewn about. Random beams and poles scattered, large equipment and no parking available on the property. Dirty and dusty
- park in a parking lot of an empty building where homeless hang out and there are no security cameras. Walk 600+ feet to your car
- no walkable destinations nearby and located in a trucking industrial part of town (priced the same as a sugarhouse or downtown apt with a pool and more amenities)
- lowered the price $200 for the same unit as a new resident because they are having trouble filling it up - yet I am expected to pay the higher rate for enduring this massive headache and quite honestly the worst apartment experience I’ve had in 27 years.

Don’t move here!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.author: Jeremy Applestein
reviews.text:
We did enjoy living here for a year.  But be warned, when you move out you will be charged a "standard cleaning fee" which is automatically taken from your deposit, regardless of what condition the apartment is left in (ours was spotless).  I've rented many other places and have never had this happen before.

In addition, I've been moved out for several months and still have not gotten my deposit back despite multiple emails and calls back and forth.  Disappointed with the unprofessionalism...

reviews.author: Dallin
reviews.text:
I couldn’t be happier with my experience at this townhouse complex! The property is beautifully maintained, safe, and welcoming. The homes are spacious and thoughtfully designed, making it such a comfortable place to live.

A special shoutout to Brian he went above and beyond to make everything smooth and stress-free. He was incredibly helpful, answered all my questions with patience, and made me feel truly taken care of throughout the entire process. His professionalism and kindness made all the difference!

reviews.author: Brittany Foster
reviews.text: I’ve had a great experience at The Quinci Apartments. The property is well taken care of, and Brian has been especially helpful and professional. He always takes the time to listen and ensures things get handled quickly.

reviews.author: Chase Maples
reviews.text:
Update: We have since moved out, but the Quinci was by far the worst "luxury living" community I've ever been in. Homeless, package theft, illegal parking at all times of day, off leash animals, fake reviews from employees of Kairoi, and a horrible location. Right now it seems the rent is effectively ~1700 a month, which is what I'd say it's worth. Rather than the 2450 they gave us for our lease renewal.

Where to even begin...To preface this review, Mikayla, Angel, and Josue are all great to work with. Moving in was easy. My partner and I have been at The Quinci for 4 months now and it has been by far the worst renting experience of our lives.

Upon move in, we were given information from previous property director Brittani about the timelines and capabilities of the amenities. These timelines were completely unfounded, as nothing besides the pickleball courts are currently available and we are a good portion through our lease already. Had we of known this, we would have chosen to live elsewhere. We are currently living in a CONSTANT construction zone, which shakes the buildings nearly everyday from 7am-4pm.

Within the past 4 months we have encountered the following issues (from least to most recent):
1. Some extremely inconsiderate tenants that trash the property with their cigarette butts and garbage
2. Off leash dogs roaming the property, sometimes with no owners in sight whatsoever
3. German cockroaches, which, hopefully, is now completely remedied.
4. Mailboxes weren't available to use for over 2 months of our lease. requiring us to drive to the airport post office to collect our mail, or wait for Mikayla to graciously collect it for us once a week.
5. Ant infestation. Now remedied.
6. Water heater wasn't turned on upon moving in, leaving us without hot water.
7. Bedroom door couldn't latch when closing
8. Charging station for electric vehicles still in development with no timelines or estimates in sight
9. Pickleball court lights only recently installed, over 3 months into our lease term
10. The grills are still not functional even though they're "Installed"
11. Rent has now decreased on this property over $200 a month and $300 a month for the 3 bedrooms.

Lastly, and the MOST important issue of all (as of late) is the complete repaving and re-construction of all of the driveways and entrances to our garages throughout the property due to it not being up to code for drainage. This is likely to leave us without access to our garages for well over a month, initially starting in early/mid October and supposedly ending mid November (originally expected end of October) with no consolation to the tenants from upper management. This has caused us to need to haul our groceries, gear, equipment, etc. 600 feet through construction each day. it's an enormous inconvenience to us as tenants, that the property owners couldn't care less about.

Mikayla has been a great help in hearing our complaints and helping us through so many of the issues we've had here. Unfortunately, enough is enough, and The Quinci is deserving of nothing more than the rating given. I highly encourage anyone reading this review and considering The Quinci to reconsider and move somewhere else more stable.

reviews.author: Serilda
reviews.text: To pay almost to what you would be paying for a house it’s not worth it. Yes the pool area and gym are nice and it’s quiet but there seems to be more theft than usual. The gates have been working on and off the cameras clearly do not work as someone’s tires have been stolen and left on bricks twice within the past week in the same area of the complex towards the front. Management grasp on to what they think is important based off their willingness to address an issue. If cameras are not going to be working but there’s fluctuating prices while leasing then other measures should be taken safety wise in the community and overall communication should be a little bit more tangible to paying tenants.

reviews.author: Mrs. Hernandez
reviews.text: My husband and I have been living here for almost two years and we love it! The environment is very quiet, and well maintained. The property staff are welcoming, respectful, and helpful which most importantly adds to this experience. Overall, Discovery has been an enjoyable experience and we would recommend this community to others!

reviews.author: alex hernandez
reviews.text: The property is beautiful inside and out! The apartments are spacious and reasonably priced. The office team is stellar — they manage the complex efficiently and create a wonderful sense of community through monthly resident events. It’s also very pet-friendly with great neighbors. I’m truly enjoying living here!

reviews.author: Dayana
reviews.text: I’ve been here for over 6 months now. My application process was very smooth and quick! My apartment is decent. I really like how quiet it is around here! Elementary at walking distance is a HUGE win for me! Maintenance always handled in a timely manner! I love that we have a security system for our apartment and how easy it was to set that up as well. Staff is always kind and ready to help. The gym is nice and big as well as the pool area. What I use on the daily is the Starbucks coffee machine! I have to make a run to the leasing office about every morning to get me a cup or two! I love that I can do that saves me so much! The Starbucks coffee machine also has Chai Tea Latte which is my fav drink from Starbucks, this saves me so much money! Win Win!

reviews.author: C W
reviews.text: Today I’d placed a work order to paint my exterior door as the outside elements had worn it a bit as I wanted to prepare to entertain visitors for the holidays. Mike, one of the maintenance personnel completed the job on today as well! It was a pleasant surprise and Ms. Jianell the property manager reached out as well to inform to give an fyi in the event I got a Vivent security entry message, it was Mike. One thing that makes this property standout is the promptness of attention to maintenance requests. Keep up the great work! It’s been very comfortable making Discovery home!

reviews.author: Thaaniyah Connelly
reviews.text: The checking in process was made easy and simple. The apartments are stylish and modern, rooms were also cleant before arrival which was great. The staff were friendly and helpful which takes the stress away especially after a long day of travelling. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.author: MAXWELL KHEHLA MJOKA
reviews.text: The views are horrible,  I have been there they always fixing elevator

reviews.author: Nosipho Mathenjwa
reviews.text: Very clean & affordable ♥️🔥

reviews.author: nozipho shabangu
reviews.text: Been staying at Luna(since 2020, when it was still City Life Premium), The have really improved a whole lot of things. The rooms are immaculate but the Rules are just too much for employed people. The limitation on the number of people and the time limit on visitors is their only downfall.. The fact that LUNA accommodates grown adults that are working it should give you the freedom to sign your visitors if and when you want too. Even if we have to pay for a visitor that needs to check out at 10am that I signed in at 3am its ok… honestly thats their only downfall… the visitors part, the limitation on daily visitors should go back to 2 and the time should be unlimited, like it was when they first introduced the app. R110 is nothing just to accommodate family/or whoever that arrives at Luna. As long as the money is paid.

reviews.author: Brian Simelane
reviews.text: I've been staying in Luna Apartments for 3 years and I don't see myself moving out anytime soon, excellent service and a peace of mind. ❤️

reviews.author: Nolwazi Manyanga
reviews.text: Very horrible. I mean I only have a month staying at Luna. When I moved in I told them I did not like the room they gave me it was nothing to what they showed me when I came to view the place. Asked them to change rooms when the month ends because when I moved in apparently the room they gave me was the only room left. Now they making me pay ANOTHER admin fee of R550. I was told that the admin fee is just a once off why am I paying it again? Poor service, I’ve been telling them I want to change rooms but now they telling me that they need to assist the new comers first then they’ll get back to me? What is that????

reviews.author: Joe Denison
reviews.text: I've had a great experience so far here. Great community events, the complex is nice and the area has a lot of restaurants nearby. Highly recommend if you are interested in moving to Denver.

reviews.author: John Somers
reviews.text: I’ve had a great experience at Park17 Apartments. The community is clean, quiet, and well maintained, and the apartments are comfortable and modern. Management has been professional and responsive whenever I’ve needed anything, and maintenance requests are handled promptly. The location is convenient and makes getting around easy. Overall, Park17 is a great place to live and I would definitely recommend it.

Much Appreciated,
Ross Arabie

reviews.author: Sarah Baxter
reviews.text: We lived here for three years and had the absolute greatest time and Stacey the manager was always there to help us out. Cannot say enough great things about this complex.
reviews.response_text: We are privileged to have had you as a resident at Pearl Lantana. Thank you for your wonderful feedback.

reviews.author: Natalia Pruszak
reviews.text: The first place I lived when moving to Austin, TX! I felt very safe in this complex, loved the gym and the two pools in between complexes. There is also a nice neighborhood nearby with an outside gym thats great for getting outdoors. 15min from the city and a great price. I found it convenient living close to a Target, HomeGoods, HEB, BlackRock Coffee and MovieHouse Eatery. Big thank you to Scott and Andres in the leasing department for being extremely responsive via email/phone and helpful in sourcing necessary documents. Would absolutely recommend!
reviews.response_text: Thanks for the wonderful review! Thrilled you enjoyed your time here and enjoyed our amenities. Scott and Andre appreciate your kind words!

reviews.author: Marla Gomez
reviews.response_text: We are thrilled to hear about your positive experience with Pearl Lantana. Your support means everything to us.

reviews.author: Kelly Sipes
reviews.text: Stacey & her staff have gone above & beyond helping me transfer from a 2-bdrm to a 1-bdrm....great location, clean property & any maintenance requests have been completed in a timely manner...would highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Sofia Russey
reviews.text: I've been here about 6 months and have had such a wonderful experience! I love the location and feel so safe living here. The amenities are great, the staff is kind and highly responsive, and the very few times I've had to call maintenance they showed up quickly and handled the request promptly!
reviews.response_text: We are pleased to hear about your wonderful experience! Thank you for highlighting our location, staff responsiveness, and maintenance team.

reviews.author: Alex Payne
reviews.text: We’ve had an excellent experience at Pearl Lantana Apartments. Stacey, Scott, and Andre are truly outstanding—friendly, attentive, and always approachable. The apartments and overall property are beautiful, with well-maintained green spaces and mini trails that are perfect for our dogs. Maintenance and upkeep are consistently exceptional. We genuinely feel at home here and highly recommend Pearl Lantana to anyone looking for a welcoming, well-run community.
reviews.response_text: We greatly appreciate your positive words about our team and we are thrilled you and your dogs love our community and green spaces.

reviews.author: Kristin Rolf
reviews.text: Though I did not decide to move, I loved the Pearl! The grounds and the amenities were so my vibe. The apartment was cozy and I loved all the modern details. Will definitely look back in a year!!

reviews.author: Levi Oelrich
reviews.response_text:
We're delighted to hear about your experience at The Station at Riverfront Park, Levi! Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. Your positive experience truly means the world to our entire team, and we're thrilled that you took the time to let us know how we're doing. 

Best Regards,
Melissa Babcock

reviews.author: Marcos Guerreiro
reviews.text: You're better off living on the streets. Management is horrible. Elevators are always breaking. There is a disgusting stink from their fire repellent pipes. We are moving out early because of it. I'll post pictures after. Oh, and no one cleans after their pets. There are feces in almost every hallway you walk through. ***There are regular car break-ins in the garage and they try to dissuaded you from making a police report, or sharing their security videos with you. ( I don't know how they have a 4.0 rating, they must be paying for rating bots, everyone of our neighbors hate it here.)
reviews.response_text:
Thank you for sharing your concerns regarding your stay at The Station two years ago.  As you know, we have completed a massive fire suppression replacement project and updated many common areas and amenities for all of our residents since your stay here.  I encourage you to swing by for a tour so that we can show you around the community which now has a fresh coat of paint, new lighting, and new flooring throughout the corridors.  We have replaced the flooring and repainted our Fitness Center, as well.  We have all new furniture, paint and flooring in the Club Room where we host up to four events each month so that we can interact with our residents outside of office hours and grow our community.  Feel free to reach out to us at any time at (720) 680-1578 to set up a tour to see all of the positive changes that we have made.  We would love to see you again!

Best Regards,
Melissa Babcock
Community Director

reviews.author: Sara Lindholm
reviews.text: I love these apartments. They're so well kept. Their new employee Josh adds the finishing touch to such a luxurious place. He fixes everything right away and he's a perfectionist which benefits me as a resident. Highly recommend.
reviews.response_text:
We are thrilled to hear you love the apartments and appreciate Josh's perfectionist approach to maintenance. It's wonderful to know that you've noticed how well-kept our apartments are, as we take great pride in maintaining the quality and luxurious feel of our community. We're delighted that our team's dedication to fixing everything right away is making such a positive impact on your experience as a resident. Your recommendation means everything to us, and feedback like yours confirms that we're providing the level of service our residents deserve.

Best Regards,
Melissa Babcock
Community Director

reviews.text: Seth and Tatum made the entire move-in experience stress free and anticlimactic (which was GREAT).

reviews.author: Andrew Billingsley
reviews.text:
Not terrible, but not great either. The actual unit I have is fine, happy with it, wasn't cleaned properly by the time I arrived but can look past it (just some scruffs and finger marks on appliances). Community is nice and inviting, and its pretty quiet. Seems like working professionals around the same age group. Its a good part of town too. Wish the parking situation for guests (or lackthereof) could be improved but given where it is in town this isn't really management's fault or problem to be fair, and the unit is nice enough to again overlook that.

The elevator closest to my unit doesn't work, and the one that does work is painfully slow. I just take the stairs now to the 4th floor but sill given the price I'd expect that to be done. Also was a pain for the movers and as a result I probably ended up paying a little more than originally anticipated. Again, can overlook this for the time being assuming the other elevator will be fixed (believe it will be based on communication I've received)

The leasing office itself leaves a bit to be desired. I'm not sure what the capacity the building(s) is (are) currently at, but it's certainly nowhere near full, so the fact they get overwhelmed with simple things like parking is pretty concerning. Today I was told by the Director via email that I wasn't permitted to park in the garage and wasn't part of my lease (it is actually part of my lease, they later confirmed it), and that I would be towed if I don't add it to my lease by 3:00PM (of course no apology for the threat).

Then the assistant director called me separately at around almost the exact same time saying that I was in the wrong spot and my spot was a spot over (how can this be true if the director claimed I have no spot). I told her that I don't think that's the case but could I move it when I get back from work, to which I was basically told 'no', and that it again could be towed and they wanted to avoid a "chain reaction" and get it taken care of as quickly as possible. Well, I drop everything I'm doing at work and walk 20 minutes down to the apartment and get in the garage and surprise surprise my car is in the RIGHT SPOT. I called the Asst. Director back and asked why I just dropped everything and came down for what they were basically pitching as an emergency when in reality  they were making problems where there was literally no issue - they screwed up two times in a row.

The Asst. Director, Tatum, basically took little accountability and seemed confused and miffed as to why I would be upset with the situation, then gave an insincere 'sorry', as if she didn’t know what she was apologizing for, which was a little strange. Again, important to remember that it wasn't a situation where they said 'please just move it tonight and check when you get back', it was instead pitched as it needed handled now in the middle of a workday.
reviews.response_text:
Thank you for your detailed feedback. We sincerely apologize for the elevator issues and the parking confusion you experienced. We understand your frustration, especially regarding the miscommunication about your parking spot and the inconvenience it caused during your workday. We take these concerns seriously and will address them promptly. Our team will review our communication processes to prevent such misunderstandings in the future. Regarding the elevator, we are working on repairs and will strive to improve its functionality. We appreciate your patience and are available if you would like to discuss these matters further to ensure your satisfaction. Please contact us at (720) 680-1578 so we can address your concerns personally and find appropriate solutions.

Best Regards,
Melissa Babcock
Community Director

reviews.author: Jose Munoz
reviews.text: Nice apartment complex and location! The staff has been very friendly and attentive. I would totally recommend living here.

reviews.author: Julia Beery
reviews.text: Location is great and staff is so friendly!
reviews.response_text: We're utterly delighted to hear that you enjoyed our location and found our staff friendly! It's wonderful to know that these aspects of your experience stood out to you. Our team works hard to provide a welcoming environment, so your kind words about their friendliness are truly appreciated. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We value your opinion and are glad we could meet your expectations in these important areas.

reviews.author: Chris Jacobsen
reviews.text: Favorite place I’ve lived at in Denver in a great location. The community is great and being rebuilt since the remodel over the past 1-2 years. Highly recommended at least viewing and scheduling a tour to see for yourself.
reviews.response_text: We're so happy to hear that The Station at Riverfront Park is your favorite place to live in Denver. Thank you for sharing your positive experience! We're thrilled that you appreciate our great location and the sense of community we've been working hard to rebuild following our recent remodel. We're glad you've noticed the improvements we've made and appreciate your recommendation!  Your satisfaction means a lot to us, and we're grateful for residents like you who help make our community so special.

reviews.author: jasper mercy
reviews.response_text: Thanks for the positive feedback, Jasper! We're delighted to hear you had a good experience with us. We truly value your support and kind words. Our team works hard to provide the best possible service, and it's rewarding to know that our efforts are appreciated. Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts.

reviews.author: Bijan Ranjbari
reviews.text: Made it simple and their very helpful
reviews.response_text: Thank you for your review, Bijan!  We strive to make the process as straightforward as possible for our residents, and it's great to hear that you found this to be the case. Our team takes pride in providing assistance whenever needed, and we're glad this was evident during your experience with us.

reviews.author: Cole McCain
reviews.text:
The Station has been an ok place to live.

Whenever I've had problems with my apartment, maintenence is timely to respond. Maintenence guys are friendly and knowledgeable--quick to make their repairs too.

Has its problems, but The Station is aight.
reviews.response_text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, Daniel. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us! Our team is always happy to help and looking forward to the continued success and changes coming to Station! 

Cheers,

The Station at Riverfront Park

reviews.author: Daniel Scholtz
reviews.text: New Management has done an amazing job at fixing everything, while keeping the residents happy..I'm excited to be a part of the community. I would highly recommend this place to anybody.. five stars all the way.  Amazing amenities,  beautiful apartments, and can't forget the amazing staff :)
reviews.response_text: Thank you immensely for your positive feedback! We're thrilled to hear you're enjoying the improvements and amenities at The Station at Riverfront Park. It's wonderful to know that you feel excited to be part of our community and that you would highly recommend us. We truly appreciate your kind words about our beautiful apartments and amazing staff. Your five-star rating means a lot to us, and we're committed to continuing to provide an excellent living experience for all our residents.

reviews.author: Jay
reviews.text: Upon move in: AC didn’t work (spent 1 week with no AC). Toilet seals were old and leaking leaving the bathrooms smelling like piss (still not resolved) one of my windows didn’t lock and I’m on a first floor (still not fixed) dishwasher leaking (still not fixed)
reviews.response_text:
Thank you for bringing these issues to our attention. We sincerely value your input and apologize for the inconvenience you've experienced. We understand how frustrating these maintenance problems can be, especially upon move-in. Our team is committed to resolving these matters promptly. Please contact us directly at (720) 680-1578 so we can address each of the maintenance issues you've mentioned.  We look forward to speaking with you and working towards a satisfactory resolution.

Best Regards,
Melissa Babcock
Community Director

reviews.author: Quinn Adkins
reviews.text: After being told the elevators would work by move-in, they did not. Apparently they have been down for months and management has no idea when they are going to be functioning again. Moving furniture up several flights of stairs increased the moving costs 2x. On top of that, the pool is not working as they said it would be. The parking garage is also under construction with limited parking and no assigned spots ($150/month). The air conditioning in my apartment does not work and it has been over 100 degrees the past weekend. I moved in recently and my experience has been terrible since.
reviews.response_text:
We are disappointed to hear about your experience and the challenges you've faced since moving in. We understand your frustration with the amenities and air conditioning, as well as the parking situation. We take these issues seriously and want to address your concerns promptly. Please contact us at (720) 680-1578 to discuss your concerns further and explore potential solutions. We are committed to improving your living experience and finding ways to resolve these issues as quickly as possible.

Best Regards,
Melissa Babcock
Community Director

reviews.text: This was so awesome we need to do it again.
reviews.response_text: Thank you so much for your review, Andrew!  We are so excited that you had fun at the Ice Cream social.  We hope to see you again at the next one!

reviews.text: Great apartment so far and the communication has been top tier.
reviews.response_text: Thank you so much, Noah!  It was so great getting to know you and Amelia yesterday.  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us!
